Acidic Slime.name: Acidic Slime
Acidic Slime.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

printings.flavor: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.

Act of Treason.name: Act of Treason
Act of Treason.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

printings.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea

Ajani Goldmane.name: Ajani Goldmane
Ajani Goldmane.text:
+1: You gain 2 life.
−1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
−6: Put a white Avatar creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total."

Alluring Siren.name: Alluring Siren
Alluring Siren.text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.

printings.flavor:
"The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, The Odyssey, trans. Pope

Angel's Feather.name: Angel's Feather
Angel's Feather.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

"Until that day I cursed the angels, those uncaring lights in the sky. They rewarded my scorn with the gift of time, every year of which I've spent in devotion to their names."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

Ant Queen.name: Ant Queen
Ant Queen.text: {1}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

printings.flavor:
"Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain

Armored Ascension.name: Armored Ascension
Armored Ascension.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Plains you control and has flying.

printings.flavor: "The meadow sprang up beneath me, and I perceived a path from our people's defeat to our highest glory."

"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin

Awakener Druid.name: Awakener Druid
Awakener Druid.text: When Awakener Druid enters the battlefield, target Forest becomes a 4/5 green Treefolk creature for as long as Awakener Druid remains on the battlefield. It's still a land.

printings.flavor: The druids of Mazar treat each seedcone with respect for the warrior it will become.

Ball Lightning.name: Ball Lightning
Ball Lightning.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

Baneslayer Angel.name: Baneslayer Angel
Baneslayer Angel.text: Flying, first strike, lifelink, protection from Demons and from Dragons

printings.flavor: Some angels protect the meek and innocent. Others seek out and smite evil wherever it lurks.

Berserkers of Blood Ridge.name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
Berserkers of Blood Ridge.text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each turn if able.

printings.flavor: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.

Birds of Paradise.name: Birds of Paradise
Birds of Paradise.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

printings.flavor: Each feather in its tail is a souvenir of an exotic land, a memory condensed in hue.

Black Knight.name: Black Knight
Black Knight.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

printings.flavor: "I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see."

Bog Wraith.name: Bog Wraith
Bog Wraith.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

printings.flavor: She died in this swamp, and so will you.

Bogardan Hellkite.name: Bogardan Hellkite
Bogardan Hellkite.text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

Borderland Ranger.name: Borderland Ranger
Borderland Ranger.text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

printings.flavor: "Only fools and bandits use roads."

Bountiful Harvest.name: Bountiful Harvest
Bountiful Harvest.text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

printings.flavor: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.

Bramble Creeper.name: Bramble Creeper
Bramble Creeper.text: Whenever Bramble Creeper attacks, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"I've seen the fully grown ones tear a baloth to gory ribbons in seconds."
—Kivi, thornberry harvester

Burning Inquiry.name: Burning Inquiry
Burning Inquiry.text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.

printings.flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.

Burst of Speed.name: Burst of Speed
Burst of Speed.text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)

printings.flavor: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.

"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."

Capricious Efreet.name: Capricious Efreet
Capricious Efreet.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target nonland permanent you control and up to two target nonland permanents you don't control. Destroy one of them at random.

printings.flavor: "You wish for great destruction? It is done, my master."

Captain of the Watch.name: Captain of the Watch
Captain of the Watch.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
When Captain of the Watch enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

Celestial Purge.name: Celestial Purge
Celestial Purge.text: Exile target black or red permanent.

printings.flavor:
"We see clearly the error of your ways. It does not matter that you choose not to."
—Urien of the Lightwielders

Cemetery Reaper.name: Cemetery Reaper
Cemetery Reaper.text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

printings.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.

"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate

Chandra Nalaar.name: Chandra Nalaar
Chandra Nalaar.text:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player.
−X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
−8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

Child of Night.name: Child of Night
Child of Night.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

printings.flavor: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.

Clone.name: Clone
Clone.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

printings.flavor: The shapeshifter mimics with a twin's esteem and a mirror's cruelty.

Coat of Arms.name: Coat of Arms
Coat of Arms.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

printings.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

Consume Spirit.name: Consume Spirit
Consume Spirit.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

Convincing Mirage.name: Convincing Mirage
Convincing Mirage.text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

printings.flavor: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."
Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.

The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

Cudgel Troll.name: Cudgel Troll
Cudgel Troll.text: {G}: Regenerate Cudgel Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

Darksteel Colossus.name: Darksteel Colossus
Darksteel Colossus.text:
Trample, indestructible
If Darksteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Darksteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

Deadly Recluse.name: Deadly Recluse
Deadly Recluse.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

Deathmark.name: Deathmark
Deathmark.text: Destroy target green or white creature.

printings.flavor: Even the noblest of intentions and strongest of wills inevitably crumble into dust.

Demon's Horn.name: Demon's Horn
Demon's Horn.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

Diabolic Tutor.name: Diabolic Tutor
Diabolic Tutor.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

printings.flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.

Disentomb.name: Disentomb
Disentomb.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

printings.flavor:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess

Disorient.name: Disorient
Disorient.text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage

"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle

Divine Verdict.name: Divine Verdict
Divine Verdict.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.

printings.flavor: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.

Djinn of Wishes.name: Djinn of Wishes
Djinn of Wishes.text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

printings.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.

Dragon Whelp.name: Dragon Whelp
Dragon Whelp.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

Dragon's Claw.name: Dragon's Claw
Dragon's Claw.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

Dragonskull Summit.name: Dragonskull Summit
Dragonskull Summit.text:
Dragonskull Summit enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

Dread Warlock.name: Dread Warlock
Dread Warlock.text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.

printings.flavor: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."

Drowned Catacomb.name: Drowned Catacomb
Drowned Catacomb.text:
Drowned Catacomb enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

Drudge Skeletons.name: Drudge Skeletons
Drudge Skeletons.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

printings.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

Duress.name: Duress
Duress.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

printings.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess

Earthquake.name: Earthquake
Earthquake.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

printings.flavor: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.
The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.

Elvish Archdruid.name: Elvish Archdruid
Elvish Archdruid.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

printings.flavor: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.

Elvish Piper.name: Elvish Piper
Elvish Piper.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

printings.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

Elvish Visionary.name: Elvish Visionary
Elvish Visionary.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

printings.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

Emerald Oryx.name: Emerald Oryx
Emerald Oryx.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

printings.flavor: After the oryx dies, its flesh returns to the earth, but its emerald bones remain as a tribute to the forest.
Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

Entangling Vines.name: Entangling Vines
Entangling Vines.text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

printings.flavor: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.
Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

Excommunicate.name: Excommunicate
Excommunicate.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

printings.flavor:
"Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden

Fabricate.name: Fabricate
Fabricate.text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

printings.flavor:
"I'm one masterpiece away from ruling this pathetic world."
—Saldrath, master artificer

Fiery Hellhound.name: Fiery Hellhound
Fiery Hellhound.text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: Once a barbarian army has conquered a region, their shamans summon hellhounds that keep undesirables out and prisoners in.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

Firebreathing.name: Firebreathing
Firebreathing.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.

Flashfreeze.name: Flashfreeze
Flashfreeze.text: Counter target red or green spell.

printings.flavor:
"Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master

Fog.name: Fog
Fog.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

printings.flavor:
"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth

Gargoyle Castle.name: Gargoyle Castle
Gargoyle Castle.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Gargoyle Castle: Put a 3/4 colorless Gargoyle artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

printings.flavor: Most knew of the tower's wizard and gargoyle. Few realized which was guardian and which was master.

Garruk Wildspeaker.name: Garruk Wildspeaker
Garruk Wildspeaker.text:
+1: Untap two target lands.
−1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
−4: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

Giant Growth.name: Giant Growth
Giant Growth.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Giant Spider.name: Giant Spider
Giant Spider.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

printings.flavor: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.

Glacial Fortress.name: Glacial Fortress
Glacial Fortress.text:
Glacial Fortress enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or an Island.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

Glorious Charge.name: Glorious Charge
Glorious Charge.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane

Goblin Artillery.name: Goblin Artillery
Goblin Artillery.text: {T}: Goblin Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

printings.flavor: Most goblins get their turn firing the catapult, but few achieve the coveted title of Ammunition Holder.

Goblin Chieftain.name: Goblin Chieftain
Goblin Chieftain.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.

printings.flavor: "We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war."
Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

Gorgon Flail.name: Gorgon Flail
Gorgon Flail.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

Gravedigger.name: Gravedigger
Gravedigger.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

printings.flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.

Great Sable Stag.name: Great Sable Stag
Great Sable Stag.text:
Great Sable Stag can't be countered.
Protection from blue and from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue or black.)

printings.flavor: Ineffable and incorruptible.

Griffin Sentinel.name: Griffin Sentinel
Griffin Sentinel.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

printings.flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.

Guardian Seraph.name: Guardian Seraph
Guardian Seraph.text:
Flying
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

printings.flavor: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.

Harm's Way.name: Harm's Way
Harm's Way.text: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

printings.flavor: Even when fate is already written, there's always time to change the names.

Haunting Echoes.name: Haunting Echoes
Haunting Echoes.text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

Hive Mind.name: Hive Mind
Hive Mind.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for his or her copy.

printings.flavor:
"All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren

"Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari
Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.

Howl of the Night Pack.name: Howl of the Night Pack
Howl of the Night Pack.text: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control.

printings.flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

Howling Banshee.name: Howling Banshee
Howling Banshee.text:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.

printings.flavor: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.

Howling Mine.name: Howling Mine
Howling Mine.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

printings.flavor: The mine's riches never end, nor do the moans of the spirits doomed to haunt them.

Hypnotic Specter.name: Hypnotic Specter
Hypnotic Specter.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

printings.flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.

Ice Cage.name: Ice Cage
Ice Cage.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

Ignite Disorder.name: Ignite Disorder
Ignite Disorder.text: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target white and/or blue creatures.

printings.flavor: The shaman prowled the academy halls, shaking his head at the pomp and babble of the sages inside. He knew just the spell to liven the place up.

Illusionary Servant.name: Illusionary Servant
Illusionary Servant.text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

printings.flavor:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren

Indestructibility.name: Indestructibility
Indestructibility.text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

Inferno Elemental.name: Inferno Elemental
Inferno Elemental.text: Whenever Inferno Elemental blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Inferno Elemental deals 3 damage to that creature.

printings.flavor:
"Those who wish to invade our monastery, please take it up with my servant."
—Chandra Nalaar

Jace Beleren.name: Jace Beleren
Jace Beleren.text:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

Jackal Familiar.name: Jackal Familiar
Jackal Familiar.text: Jackal Familiar can't attack or block alone.

printings.flavor:
"Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord

Jump.name: Jump
Jump.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage

Kalonian Behemoth.name: Kalonian Behemoth
Kalonian Behemoth.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

printings.flavor:
"Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger
The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.

Kindled Fury.name: Kindled Fury
Kindled Fury.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane

Kraken's Eye.name: Kraken's Eye
Kraken's Eye.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

Lava Axe.name: Lava Axe
Lava Axe.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

printings.flavor: "Catch!"
The horses of Scytha's army must be well trained. A thrown rider would fall miles before meeting the ground.

Lifelink.name: Lifelink
Lifelink.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

printings.flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.

Lightning Elemental.name: Lightning Elemental
Lightning Elemental.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

printings.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

Lightwielder Paladin.name: Lightwielder Paladin
Lightwielder Paladin.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Lightwielder Paladin deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target black or red permanent that player controls.

Liliana Vess.name: Liliana Vess
Liliana Vess.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

printings.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

Looming Shade.name: Looming Shade
Looming Shade.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.

Lurking Predators.name: Lurking Predators
Lurking Predators.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put that card on the bottom of your library.

printings.flavor: All are prey to the eyes of the wild.

Magebane Armor.name: Magebane Armor
Magebane Armor.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+4 and loses flying.
Prevent all noncombat damage that would be dealt to equipped creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

Magma Phoenix.name: Magma Phoenix
Magma Phoenix.text:
Flying
When Magma Phoenix dies, it deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
{3}{R}{R}: Return Magma Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.

Manabarbs.name: Manabarbs
Manabarbs.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

printings.flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

Master of the Wild Hunt.name: Master of the Wild Hunt
Master of the Wild Hunt.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}: Tap all untapped Wolf creatures you control. Each Wolf tapped this way deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power divided as its controller chooses among any number of those Wolves.

Megrim.name: Megrim
Megrim.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

printings.flavor:
"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

Merfolk Looter.name: Merfolk Looter
Merfolk Looter.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

printings.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

Merfolk Sovereign.name: Merfolk Sovereign
Merfolk Sovereign.text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.

printings.flavor: "The sharks envy our ferocity. The eels envy our cunning."

Mesa Enchantress.name: Mesa Enchantress
Mesa Enchantress.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

printings.flavor: She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.

Might of Oaks.name: Might of Oaks
Might of Oaks.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
May your weapon be no sword forged. May your armor be no metal wrought.
—Elvish saying

Mind Control.name: Mind Control
Mind Control.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

printings.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

Mind Shatter.name: Mind Shatter
Mind Shatter.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

printings.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

Mirror of Fate.name: Mirror of Fate
Mirror of Fate.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror of Fate: Choose up to seven face-up exiled cards you own. Exile all the cards from your library, then put the chosen cards on top of your library.

printings.flavor: As the glass shattered, forgotten realities and dead memories came flooding back.

Mist Leopard.name: Mist Leopard
Mist Leopard.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

printings.flavor:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

Mold Adder.name: Mold Adder
Mold Adder.text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Mold Adder.

printings.flavor: The more you struggle against its coils, the tighter they get.
If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

Nature's Spiral.name: Nature's Spiral
Nature's Spiral.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. (A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.)

printings.flavor: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.
Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
Nightmare.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

printings.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

Open the Vaults.name: Open the Vaults
Open the Vaults.text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owners' control. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in graveyards.)

printings.flavor: When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.

Ornithopter.name: Ornithopter
Ornithopter.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

printings.flavor: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.

Overrun.name: Overrun
Overrun.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

Pacifism.name: Pacifism
Pacifism.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

printings.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

Palace Guard.name: Palace Guard
Palace Guard.text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.

printings.flavor: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

Panic Attack.name: Panic Attack
Panic Attack.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

printings.flavor:
"What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren

Pithing Needle.name: Pithing Needle
Pithing Needle.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

printings.flavor: It disables with pinpoint accuracy.

Platinum Angel.name: Platinum Angel
Platinum Angel.text:
Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

printings.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

Ponder.name: Ponder
Ponder.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

printings.flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.

Prized Unicorn.name: Prized Unicorn
Prized Unicorn.text: All creatures able to block Prized Unicorn do so.

printings.flavor:
"The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

Prodigal Pyromancer.name: Prodigal Pyromancer
Prodigal Pyromancer.text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."

Protean Hydra.name: Protean Hydra
Protean Hydra.text:
Protean Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Protean Hydra, prevent that damage and remove that many +1/+1 counters from it.
Whenever a +1/+1 counter is removed from Protean Hydra, put two +1/+1 counters on it at the beginning of the next end step.

Pyroclasm.name: Pyroclasm
Pyroclasm.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

printings.flavor:
"Who'd want to ignite things one at a time?"
—Chandra Nalaar

Raging Goblin.name: Raging Goblin
Raging Goblin.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

printings.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

Rampant Growth.name: Rampant Growth
Rampant Growth.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

printings.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

Razorfoot Griffin.name: Razorfoot Griffin
Razorfoot Griffin.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

printings.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

Regenerate.name: Regenerate
Regenerate.text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

printings.flavor: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."

Relentless Rats.name: Relentless Rats
Relentless Rats.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

Rhox Pikemaster.name: Rhox Pikemaster
Rhox Pikemaster.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Soldier creatures you control have first strike.

printings.flavor: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.

Righteousness.name: Righteousness
Righteousness.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.

Rise from the Grave.name: Rise from the Grave
Rise from the Grave.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

printings.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess

Rod of Ruin.name: Rod of Ruin
Rod of Ruin.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor:
"My masterpiece is complete—and so shall be my triumph."
—Saldrath, master artificer

Rootbound Crag.name: Rootbound Crag
Rootbound Crag.text:
Rootbound Crag enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Forest.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

printings.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

Safe Passage.name: Safe Passage
Safe Passage.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.

printings.flavor: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.

Sage Owl.name: Sage Owl
Sage Owl.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

printings.flavor: Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.

Sanguine Bond.name: Sanguine Bond
Sanguine Bond.text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

printings.flavor:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

Seismic Strike.name: Seismic Strike
Seismic Strike.text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

printings.flavor:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

Serpent of the Endless Sea.name: Serpent of the Endless Sea
Serpent of the Endless Sea.text:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

Serra Angel.name: Serra Angel
Serra Angel.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

printings.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.

Shivan Dragon.name: Shivan Dragon
Shivan Dragon.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper

Siege-Gang Commander.name: Siege-Gang Commander
Siege-Gang Commander.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

Sign in Blood.name: Sign in Blood
Sign in Blood.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

printings.flavor:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.text: Your opponents can't cast spells this turn. (Spells cast before this resolves are unaffected.)

printings.flavor:
"All the wizardry in the world has to pass through one small and easily sealed door."
—Ajani Goldmane
Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

printings.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage
Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

Solemn Offering.name: Solemn Offering
Solemn Offering.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

printings.flavor:
"A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs

Soul Bleed.name: Soul Bleed
Soul Bleed.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.

printings.flavor: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.

Soul Warden.name: Soul Warden
Soul Warden.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

Sparkmage Apprentice.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
Sparkmage Apprentice.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

printings.flavor: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.

Spellbook.name: Spellbook
Spellbook.text: You have no maximum hand size.

printings.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

Sphinx Ambassador.name: Sphinx Ambassador
Sphinx Ambassador.text:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player names a card. If you searched for a creature card that isn't the named card, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

Stampeding Rhino.name: Stampeding Rhino
Stampeding Rhino.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

printings.flavor:
"Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster

Stone Giant.name: Stone Giant
Stone Giant.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

printings.flavor: A typical day for a giant. A momentous event for a goat.

"At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable

Sunpetal Grove.name: Sunpetal Grove
Sunpetal Grove.text:
Sunpetal Grove enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or a Plains.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

Telepathy.name: Telepathy
Telepathy.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

printings.flavor:
"The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student
"Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."

Tendrils of Corruption.name: Tendrils of Corruption
Tendrils of Corruption.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

printings.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.

Terramorphic Expanse.name: Terramorphic Expanse
Terramorphic Expanse.text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

Time Warp.name: Time Warp
Time Warp.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

printings.flavor: Just when you thought you'd survived the first wave.

Tome Scour.name: Tome Scour
Tome Scour.text: Target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

printings.flavor: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.

Traumatize.name: Traumatize
Traumatize.text: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

printings.flavor:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus

Trumpet Blast.name: Trumpet Blast
Trumpet Blast.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.

Twincast.name: Twincast
Twincast.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

printings.flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.

Undead Slayer.name: Undead Slayer
Undead Slayer.text: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.

printings.flavor: "My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls."

Underworld Dreams.name: Underworld Dreams
Underworld Dreams.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

printings.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari

Unsummon.name: Unsummon
Unsummon.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

printings.flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

Vampire Aristocrat.name: Vampire Aristocrat
Vampire Aristocrat.text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."

Vampire Nocturnus.name: Vampire Nocturnus
Vampire Nocturnus.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.

printings.flavor: "Your life will set with the sun."

Veteran Armorsmith.name: Veteran Armorsmith
Veteran Armorsmith.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.

printings.flavor: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."

Veteran Swordsmith.name: Veteran Swordsmith
Veteran Swordsmith.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.

printings.flavor: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."

Viashino Spearhunter.name: Viashino Spearhunter
Viashino Spearhunter.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

printings.flavor: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.

Wall of Bone.name: Wall of Bone
Wall of Bone.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

Wall of Faith.name: Wall of Faith
Wall of Faith.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

printings.flavor:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth

Wall of Fire.name: Wall of Fire
Wall of Fire.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

printings.flavor: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.

Wall of Frost.name: Wall of Frost
Wall of Frost.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

printings.flavor:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd

Warp World.name: Warp World
Warp World.text: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of his or her library.

printings.flavor: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.
"For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."

Whispersilk Cloak.name: Whispersilk Cloak
Whispersilk Cloak.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {2}

White Knight.name: White Knight
White Knight.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

printings.flavor: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.

Windstorm.name: Windstorm
Windstorm.text: Windstorm deals X damage to each creature with flying.

printings.flavor:
"We don't like interlopers and thieves cluttering our skies."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

Wurm's Tooth.name: Wurm's Tooth
Wurm's Tooth.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

printings.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

Xathrid Demon.name: Xathrid Demon
Xathrid Demon.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.

printings.flavor: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.
"I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."

"Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord
